sdg-SE_ADT_FUNS-FEMALE-16-65.def: From UNESCO:The percentage of youth (aged 15-24 years) and of adults (aged 15 years and above) who achieve or exceed a given level of proficiency in (a) literacy and (b) numeracy.From OECD:Assessment of the proficiency of adults (16-65 year olds) in the domains of literacy, numeracy and problem solving in technology-rich environments. One hour cognitive assessment plus a background questionnaire of around 30-45 minutes.
sdg-SE_ADT_FUNS-FEMALE-16-65.name: Proportion of population achieving at least a fixed level of proficiency in functional skills, by sex, age and type of skill (%)
sdg-SE_ADT_FUNS-FEMALE-16-65.source: Programme for the International Assessment of Adult Competencies (PIAAC) Data extracted on 01 April 2022.
